actions.text: Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.
Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce discharged in House.
Measure passed House, amended, in lieu of H.R. 11998.
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 95-1322.

official_title: A bill to amend the Consumer Product Safety Act to establish an interim consumer product safety rule relating to the standards for flame resistance and corrosiveness of certain insulation, and for other purposes.
short_title: Emergency Interim Consumer Product Safety Standard Act

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 95-1322) Emergency Interim Consumer Product Safety Standard Act - Amends the Consumer Product Safety Act to provide an interim mandatory safety standard for flame resistance and corrosiveness for cellulose insulation. Requires the Consumer Product Safety Commission to enforce such rule in the same manner as any other consumer product safety rule. Requires the Commission to promulgate a final rule if the Commission determines that the interim rule does not adequately protect the public. Requires the Commission to submit reports to the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation and the House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce on its enforcement of this Act. Authorizes the Commission to require that any person required to comply with the certification requirements of the Consumer Product Safety Act with respect to the manufacture of cellulose insulation use an independent third party's laboratory to do its testing for certification.

titles.title: Emergency Interim Consumer Product Safety Standard Act
Emergency Interim Consumer Product Safety Rule Act

A bill to amend the Consumer Product Safety Act to establish an interim consumer product safety rule relating to the standards for flame resistance and corrosiveness of certain insulation, and for other purposes.
